data.title: Venezuelan oil sale proceeds no longer routed through Qatar, US energy sec says

TotalEnergies mulls sale of German charging station business, The Pioneer reports
data.description:
Feb 27 - French oil major TotalEnergiesÂ  is exploring the sale of its charging station business in Germany and is looking for a possible buyer, news site The Pioneer reported on Friday, citing a sales prospectus provided by consulting firm Roland Berger.

Total, which operates almost 80,000 EV charge points across Europe, is increasingly shifting to a partnership model as the pace of electrification is slower than the industry had hoped.

* Total signed EV charging partnerships with La Banque desTerritoires for France in October and Tikehau Capital forBelgium and the Netherlands in February. * The sale prospectus for its German unit Total EnergiesCharging Solutions Deutschland mostly involves charging hubsbeing built under a government contract worth up to 152 millioneuros ($179 million), The Pioneer reported. * A spokesperson for TotalEnergies said the company does notcomment on market rumours. * The unit operates over 7,000 charging stations in Germanyand is building over 1,250 charging parks in 167 locations aspart of the government contract, according to Total. * The European Commission in December unveiled a plan todrop the EU's effective ban on new combustion-engine cars from2035, marking the bloc's biggest retreat from its green policiesin recent years.

($1 = 0.8480 euros)

(Reporting by Alessandro Parodi; Editing by Matt Scuffham)

data.title: Wholesale Prices Accelerated in January, PPI Data Show
data.description:
By Matt Grossman

Monthly wholesale unexpectedly inflation sped up in January, the Labor Department said Friday.

The producer-price index increased by 0.5% last month, after rising by 0.4% in December. Economists polled by The Wall Street Journal were expecting a 0.3% increase.

Over the 12 months through January, wholesale prices were up 2.9%.

PPI inflation reflects the prices that businesses receive for their goods and services, including in business-to-business transactions, but without retailers' markups or distribution costs. These figures are more volatile than the widely tracked consumer-price index, which reflects the prices shoppers see at businesses and online.

Wall Street analysts watch the producer-price index closely, however, because some of its price data are blended with CPI figures and import prices to calculate the personal-consumption expenditures price index, the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation metric.

Analysts can therefore use Friday's numbers to refine their forecasts for the January PCE inflation report, due on March 13. Those refreshed forecasts will arrive later Friday morning.

Write to Matt Grossman at matt.grossman@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

02-27-26 0857ET

data.title: OpenAI CEO says still have a long, stateless API exclusivity with Microsoft
OpenAI's $110 billion funding round draws investment from Amazon , Nvidia, SoftBank
data.description:
Feb 27 (Reuters) - Amazon will invest $50 billion in OpenAI, starting with an initial $15 billion and followed by another $35 billion in the coming months, the companies said on Friday.

The investment is part of a massive funding round for OpenAI, which is raising $110 billion in new investment at a pre-money valuation of $730 billion. The round also includes $30 billion from SoftBank and $30 billion from Nvidia.

Amazon's cloud computing platform, AWS, will be the exclusive third-party cloud provider for OpenAI Frontier, the ChatGPT maker's enterprise platform for building, deploying and managing AI agents.

OpenAI will consume 2 gigawatts of capacity powered by Amazon's in-house Trainium chips to support computing demand, the companies said.

(Reporting by Deborah Sophia in Bengaluru; Editing by Arun Koyyur)

Jinko Solar Co., Ltd. Reports Earnings Results for the Full Year Ended December 31, 2025
data.description:
Jinko Solar Co., Ltd. reported earnings results for the full year ended December 31, 2025. For the full year, the company reported sales was CNY 65,491.92 million compared to CNY 92,471.33 million a year ago. Net loss was CNY 6,785.93 million compared to net income of CNY 98.93 million a year ago.

Basic loss per share from continuing operations was CNY 0.68 compared to basic earnings per share from continuing operations of CNY 0.01 a year ago.

data.title: Mizuho Financial Group, Inc. Announces Changes in Board Roles and Executive, Effective April 1, 2026
data.description:
Mizuho Financial Group, Inc. announced that effective April 1, 2026, Hidekatsu Take will be appointed as Chairperson and Member of the Board of Directors. Masayuki Sugawara will become Deputy President & Corporate Executive (Representative Corporate Executive). Masayuki Sugawara, born on August 21, 1964, graduated from the School of Law at Hokkaido University in March 1988 and joined the Mizuho group the same year.He became an Executive Officer and General Manager of the Bangkok Branch at Mizuho Bank in April 2017, In April 2019 to Managing Executive Officer and Head of East Asia at both Mizuho Bank Ltd. (until April 2023) and Mizuho Financial Group, Inc. (until July 2021).

In August 2019, he was appointed Chairman of Mizuho Bank (China) Ltd., serving until June 2023. In July 2021, Group Executive Officer and CEO for East Asia at Mizuho Financial Group, Inc. In April 2023 when he became Senior Executive Officer and Head of the Corporate & Investment Banking Company at Mizuho Financial Group, Inc., while simultaneously serving as Managing Executive Officer and Head of the Corporate & Investment Banking Division at Mizuho Bank Ltd. In April 2024, he was appointed Deputy President (Representative Director) and Head of the Corporate & Investment Banking Division at Mizuho Bank Ltd., and as of April 2025, he serves as Senior Managing Corporate Executive and Head of the Corporate & Investment Banking Company at Mizuho Financial Group, Inc.

UK still considering Leonardo helicopter deal as deadline looms
data.description:
LONDON/ROME, Feb 27 (Reuters) - Britain has not yet taken a decision on awarding Italian company Leonardo a 1 billion pound ($1.35 billion) contract to build a new fleet of military helicopters, the defence ministry said on Friday, with a deadline two days away.

Leonardo, which owns Britain's last military helicopter manufacturing site, in southwest England, is the only remaining bidder and has said the factory, with 3,000 workers, will shut if it does not get the contract.

Its tender offer expires on March 1, a source told Reuters, following reports on Sky News earlier. The source said further talks between the government and Leonardo were likely in the coming days.

A spokesperson for Leonardo declined to comment.

A ministry spokesperson said: "The UK's New Medium Helicopter programme is ongoing and no final procurement decisions have yet been made. That outcome will be confirmed in due course," a MoD spokesperson said.

Sky News said defence minister John Healey had been due to visit the factory in Yeovil on Thursday to announce the deal but pulled out because the finance ministry had yet to sign it off.

The government has previously said it needs to finalise its defence investment plan before it can award the helicopter contract.

That plan has been delayed from the autumn amid media speculation about a 28 billion pound ($38 billion) hole in the military budget, despite Prime Minister Keir Starmer's pledges to boost defence spending.

The Yeovil facility dates back to 1915, when it was known as Westland and made planes used in World War One. It pivoted to helicopters in the 1950s and has recently produced the Merlin and Apache helicopters.

As well as the 3,000 jobs on site, a further 9,000 jobs in the supply chain are supported by the factory.

($1 = 0.7422 pounds)

(Reporting by Sarah Young and Giulia Segreti; Editing by Kevin Liffey)

data.title: China Petroleum & Chemical Corporation Announces Resignation of Guo Xusheng as A Chief Geologist of Sinopec Corp. , Effective February 27, 2026
data.description: China Petroleum & Chemical Corporation received Mr. Guo Xusheng's resignation on 27 February 2026 as a Chief Geologist of Sinopec Corp. due to his age. Mr. Guo Xusheng has confirmed that he has no disagreement with the Board and there are no other matters relating to his resignation that need to be brought to the attention of shareholders of Sinopec Corp.
